intro: Sterculia apetala var. apetala, commonly known as the naked flowered sterculia, is a tropical tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, cream-colored flowers that lack petals, giving it its common name. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
